1.text: When it comes to time, investment and planning, we tend to place ourselves last

2.text: on our priority list. Pushing things oﬀ for later has almost become a second habit

3.text: what  with  monthly  EMIs,  child’s  studies  and  daily  expenses  taking  up  our  time.

4.text: Sooner or later our retirement will soon catch up, but are we prepared?

6.text: (cid:127)  Your retirement years will last as long as the number of your working years.

7.text: (cid:127)  In India, healthcare costs are rising at an astonishing rate of over 10% p.a.

8.text: Therefore, growing older means more will be your medical expenses.

9.text: (cid:127)    In the future, your salary may not be able to keep up with rising inﬂation.

10.text: A monthly saving of Rs. 25,000 will be equivalent to Rs. 5596 a(cid:29)er some 30 years.

11.text: (cid:127)  Maintaining the same lifestyle in your retirement will also be subject to inﬂation.

12.text:
For example: If your monthly expense is Rs. 35,000, and if you retire 30 years from now, 
you will need Rs. 1.56 lakhs every month, if the annual rate of inﬂation is 5%.

13.text: YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES DON’T END AT RETIREMENT:

14.text: Securing your ﬁnances well before retirement can help you:

16.text: (cid:127)    Fulﬁl dreams and aspirations you put oﬀ for later

10.text: (cid:127)   80%-100% of its investments will be in equity and

12.text: Here’s why you should start planning for your 30s,

13.text:
Time:  You  have  close  to  3  decades  until  your  retirement,  which 
means you can seek to generate an adequate amount of wealth to live your post-retirement 
dream.

14.text: Savings: Having fewer expenditure avenues means you can allocate more towards savings.

15.text:
Risk Proﬁle: A lower age bracket coupled with more time in your hands to plan for retirement, 
means an aggressive asset allocation will prove ideal for you.

16.text:
ADITYA BIRLA SUN LIFE RETIREMENT FUND
(cid:31) ‘THE 40s PLAN’

17.text: (cid:127)   ‘The 40s Plan’ is also designed for wealth creation and

18.text: capital growth over a long period of time.

19.text: (cid:127)   65%-80% of its investments will be in equity and

20.text: related instruments, while 20% - 35% of its allocation

21.text: will go to debt & money market instruments.

22.text: Here’s why you should start planning for your 40s,

23.text:
Time:  You  have  close  to  2  decades  until  your  retirement,  which 
means you can accumulate an adequate amount of wealth to live your post-retirement dream.

0.text:
Savings: While your expenditures grow in your 40s so does your income. A higher income can 
help balance your focus between current responsibilities and planning for your future.

1.text:
Risk Proﬁle: This period may warrant a ‘Step-Up’ (increase) in regular savings amount (SIP 
amount) but with a moderate to high growth orientation & risk.

2.text:
ADITYA BIRLA SUN LIFE RETIREMENT FUND
(cid:31) ‘THE 50s PLAN’

3.text:
(cid:127)   ‘The 50s Plan’ is designed to aim for gradual and
   moderate growth. Higher focus will be given to
   preservation and consistency of growth.

4.text:
(cid:127)   75% - 100% of its investments will go to debt & money
   market instruments, while 0-25% of its allocation will
  go to equity and equity related instruments.

5.text: Here’s why you should start planning for your 50s,

6.text:
Time: Your retirement goals are now nearing, and your need for regular & steady income asset 
class will also increase.

7.text:
Savings: The biggest advantage of being in your 50s is that you would have fulﬁlled some of 
your goals. Your income would be at a peak, which will directly beneﬁt in terms of savings.

8.text:
Risk  Proﬁle:  The  focus  shi(cid:29)s  to  sustaining  and  increasing  your  wealth.  Here,  regular 
investments (SIP) can periodically be topped up with lump sum investments.

9.text:
ADITYA BIRLA SUN LIFE RETIREMENT FUND
(cid:31)  ‘THE 50s PLUS (cid:31) DEBT PLAN’

10.text:
‘The  50  Plus-Debt  Plan’  will  allocate  up  to  100%  of  its 
investments to debt & money market instruments of high 
credit quality to meet your post retirement needs.

11.text: Here’s why you should start planning for your 60s,

12.text:
Time:  Some  of  your  most  pressing  responsibilities  are 
behind you. Now, it’s time to focus on the life you want to lead.

13.text:
Savings:  While  your  monthly  income  will  cease,  your  monthly 
annuities that come from your retirement corpus will give you peace of mind.

14.text:
Risk  Proﬁle:  Risk  is  minimized  substantially,  so  that  you  can  focus  your  attention  on 
accomplishing your post-retirement goals.

15.text:
*Choice of plan/asset allocation is purely voluntary and every investor has the option to invest in any one/some/all of the 
plans. They are also permitted to switch among the plans.

1.text:
Systematic  Investment  Plan  (SIP):  Allows  you  to  invest  a  particular  amount 
periodically.
Preferred by salaried class and those who have regular income

2.text:
1.   Regular monthly contributions
2.  Beneﬁts from rupee cost averaging and multiple market cycles 
3.

3.text: Instils discipline of investing through SIPs

4.text:
Century Systematic Investment Plan (C-SIP): Allows you to get a life cover of 
up to 100 times (Max. Rs. 50 lakhs) the monthly SIP amount at no additional cost.

5.text:
Step-Up  SIP:  Disciplined  savings  started  early  in  life  have  to  be  stepped  up  as 
income grows to build a larger corpus for the retirement goal. As income grows over 
years, savings can be stepped up using this facility.

6.text: Lump  sum  Investments:  Apart  from  SIP  savings,  lump  sum  money  can  also  be

7.text: invested from time-to-time in any plan of your choice from this scheme.

8.text: Performance bonus or any other lump sum money received could also be invested in

9.text: this scheme at any point of time.

10.text:
Multiple Plan Investment Facility: Provides you with the choice of investing in any 
combination of plans from the 30s, 40s, 50s and 50s Plus-Debt Plan at the time of 
initial investments. You can begin your investments in SIPs or in lump sums for any

12.text:
A 50s Plan is advisable when you are nearer to your retirement and looking for low investment 
risk. A 30s Plan option could be suitable for those who have enough years to their retirement.

13.text:
Systematic Transfer Plan (STP): This will be applicable on attaining 60 years of 
age or on completion of the lock-in period, whichever is earlier.

14.text:
Systematic Withdrawal Plan (SWP): This will be applicable on attaining 60 years 
of age or on completion of the lock-in period, whichever is earlier.

15.text:
Switching Options (Intra-Scheme Switching Option): You can switch from one 
of the plans to any of the others in the Aditya Birla Sun Life Retirement Fund (from 
the 30s Plan to 40s Plan, 50s Plan or the 50s Plus-Debt Plan).

16.text:
Trigger Facility: Facilitates seamless transition of risk proﬁle and asset allocation. 
As one grows older and reaches new milestones in life, it calls for automatic changes 
in asset allocation (change of one plan to another).

17.text:
For instance, when an investor turns 40, the investment plan would change from The 30s Plan 
to The 40s Plan. Similarly, the investment plan would change to 50s, as investor turns 50. To 
obtain this facility, the investor needs to opt for it while investing in the scheme.

0.text:
Start Now. Relax Later.
Life doesn’t stop at retirement. In fact, retirement is your opportunity to pursue the 
dreams you have been putting oﬀ for later.

1.text: An early start can help you in two ways:

4.text: You need to save a lot less to accumulate the same corpus.

5.text:
You can aﬀord to take more risks by having an aggressive portfolio, hence generate more
returns.

6.text: Time to make a small but signiﬁcant change.

7.text:
There  will  always  be  many  things  jostling  for  your  attention,  but  investing  a  little 
time and money for yourself, starting now, can go a long way in ensuring that when

8.text: your retirement ﬁnally arrives, you can meet it with passion and enthusiasm.

9.text: For detailed terms & conditions of the facility, please refer to the SID of the scheme.

10.text:
Aditya  Birla  Sun  Life  Century  SIP  is  a  facility,  in  addition  to  the  conventional  SIP  facility,  oﬀered  under  designated 
schemes which give the beneﬁt of Life Insurance cover to the eligible investors. Life Insurance cover is subject to limits 
and other terms and conditions as speciﬁed for availing Century SIP, an optional, add-on, facility made available under 
designated schemes of Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund. This communication contains only few features of Century SIP. 
For further details and terms and conditions, investors are requested to refer to the Scheme Information Document of 
designated  schemes  or  visit  our  website  before  availing  Aditya  Birla  Sun  Life  Century  SIP.  Further,  the  Group  Life 
Insurance cover will be governed by the terms, conditions & exclusions of the insurance policy with the relevant Insurance 
Company as determined by the Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC Ltd. (ABSLAMC). ABSLAMC reserves the right to modify/annul 
the said Group Insurance Cover on a prospective basis. Insurance is a subject matter of solicitation.
